parameters.name: hits
parameters.description: Chromosome-specific *bam files containing aligned reads

parameters.name: clean
parameters.description: Clean run (remove old splitfile)

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label describing the data or experiment

parameters.name: reads
parameters.description: Number of reads per sub-file

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Quality value of all bases in fasta mode (Default: 30)

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Name of species, e.g., human, mouse, rat.

parameters.name: matefile
parameters.description: Paired-end mate file complementary to inputfile (e.g., s_1_2_sequence.fastq)

parameters.name: inputfile
parameters.description: Solexa FASTQ format sequence file

parameters.name: inputtype
parameters.description: Type of input sequence. Valid inputs: fastq, fasta, export or qseq

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Print ELAND alignment files to this directory (will create the directory if it does not exist)

parameters.name: pairparams
parameters.description: Paired read analysis parameters to pass to pickBestPair. Default: '--circular' (treats all chromosomes as circular).

parameters.name: seedlength
parameters.description: Length of read used for ELAND alignment (Default: min. of seedlength and 32)

parameters.name: referencedir
parameters.description: Directory containing squashed reference genome files

parameters.name: inputdir
parameters.description: Location of directory containing *.fa files

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Print indexed files to this directory

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Add this to the filenames of the converted files to identify the experiment/data test this

parameters.name: matefile
parameters.description: Complementary FASTQ reads file for input files

parameters.name: inputfile
parameters.description: FASTQ file not in ELAND format (for use with ELAND_standalone.pl)

parameters.name: inputdir
parameters.description: Location of directory containing *.fa files
parameters.paramFunction: if ( referencedir != null && referencedir != ) return referencedir; if ( outputdir != null && outputdir != ) return outputdir; if ( inputdir != null && inputdir != ) return inputdir;

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Print indexed files to this directory
parameters.paramFunction: if ( referencedir != null && referencedir != ) return referencedir; if ( outputdir != null && outputdir != ) return outputdir; if ( inputdir != null && inputdir != ) return inputdir;

parameters.name: inputdir
parameters.description: Location of directory containing *.fa files

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Print indexed files to this directory

parameters.name: inputdir
parameters.description: Location of directory containing *.fa files

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Print indexed files to this directory

parameters.name: cpus
parameters.description: Max. number of cpus per job (1 to 4) (DEFAULT = 4)

parameters.name: hits
parameters.description: A list of read alignments in SAM format. SAM is a compact short read alignment format that is increasingly being adopted.

parameters.name: jobs
parameters.description: Max. number of concurrent cluster jobs (DEFAULT = 30)

parameters.name: keep
parameters.description: Keep intermediate files

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Name to used to submit jobs to cluster (e.g., tophat-sample1)

parameters.name: queue
parameters.description: Cluster queue options

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Additional parameters to be passed to tophat (e.g., --solexa1.3-quals

parameters.name: coverage
parameters.description: A UCSC BedGraph wigglegram track, showing the depth of coverage at each position, including the spliced read alignments.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: The  mean inner distance between first read and its mate pair (corresponds to -r/--mate-inner-dist argument to Tophat)

parameters.name: junctions
parameters.description: A UCSC BED track of junctions reported by TopHat. Each junction consists of two connected BED blocks, where each block is as long as the maximal overhang of any read spanning the junction. The score is the number of alignments spanning the junction.

parameters.name: matefiles
parameters.description: Comma-separated *sequence.txt mate file names (e.g., s_1_2_sequence.txt,s_2_2_sequence.txt) with locations as paths relative to the output directory

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Create this directory and write output files to it

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Location of indexed reference file  (NB: Use file stub, e.g., /some/path/hg19)

parameters.name: inputfiles
parameters.description: Comma-separated *sequence.txt file names (e.g., s_1_1_sequence.txt,s_2_1_sequence.txt)

parameters.name: outputfile
parameters.description: SAM file containing

parameters.name: snp
parameters.description: List of raw SNPs extracted from comparison of consensus and reference files

parameters.name: clean
parameters.description: Clean run (remove old splitfile)

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: A one-word label describing the experiment or data

parameters.name: queue
parameters.description: Submit to a particular queue or add other submission options

parameters.name: reads
parameters.description: Number of reads per batch input file (Default = 1 million)

parameters.name: convert
parameters.description: Convert from Solexa FASTQ to Sanger FASTQ

parameters.name: dupfile
parameters.description: Same as out.map file but with duplicate reads aligned against the reference with identical outer coordinates removed

parameters.name: mapfile
parameters.description: Binary mapping file containing alignment of all reads against reference

parameters.name: maxjobs
parameters.description: Maximum number of concurrently queued or running jobs on the cluster queue for this run (Default: 30)

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Species name (e.g., human, mouse)

parameters.name: indelsoa
parameters.description: Predicted homozygous indels

parameters.name: matefile
parameters.description: Second paired-end sequence file

parameters.name: PE-indels
parameters.description: Indel calls, only produced with paired-end reads

parameters.name: consensus
parameters.description: Consensus sequence and qualities in FASTQ format

parameters.name: inputfile
parameters.description: Single read or first paired-end sequence file

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Output alignment and SNP files will be printed to this directory

parameters.name: splitfile
parameters.description: File containing list of batch input sequence file locations

parameters.name: snp-filter
parameters.description: Filtered SNP predictions based on indelsoa, indelpe and cns.snp files

parameters.name: referencedir
parameters.description: Directory containing MAQ format binary fasta (.bfa) files for all human chromosomes

parameters.name: hzsnps-filter
parameters.description: Filtered predicted homozygous indels

parameters.name: dbsnp
parameters.description: dbSNP version for given species

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Name of the reference species (e.g., human, mouse)

parameters.name: inputdir
parameters.description: Directory with one subdirectory per reference chromosome, each containing an out.sam or out.bam alignment output file
parameters.paramFunction: if ( outdir1 != null && outdir1 !=  ) return outdir1; if ( outdir2 != null && outdir2 !=  ) return outdir2;

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Directory with one subdirectory per reference chromosome, each containing an out.sav output file

parameters.name: referencedir
parameters.description: Location of directory containing chr*.fa reference files

parameters.name: inputdir
parameters.description: Directory with one subdirectory per reference chromosome, each containing an out.sav extended pileup format file of predicted SNPs and annotation information

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Directory with one subdirectory per reference chromosome, each containing an out.sav.flt filterSNP output file

parameters.name: lines
parameters.description: Print this number of lines

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Start printing lines from the inputfile after this number of lines

parameters.name: inputfile
parameters.description: Print lines from this source file

parameters.name: outputfile
parameters.description: Print lines to this target file

parameters.name: outputfile
parameters.description: File containing the user-specified number of lines from the inputfile, starting from the offset (default: 0)

parameters.name: regex
parameters.description: Regular expression to identify chromosome files (Default: .fa)

parameters.name: inputdir
parameters.description: Directory containing reference sequence files
parameters.paramFunction: if ( referencedir != null && referencedir != ) return referencedir; if ( inputdir != null && inputdir != ) return inputdir; if ( outputdir != null && outputdir != ) return outputdir;

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Create subdirs in this directory containing links to reference files
parameters.paramFunction: if ( referencedir != null && referencedir != ) return referencedir; if ( inputdir != null && inputdir != ) return inputdir; if ( outputdir != null && outputdir != ) return outputdir;

parameters.name: referencedir
parameters.description: Output reference directory containing per-chromosome subdirs with (linked) chromosome sequence files.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Download files linked on this page

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of page: html or text

parameters.name: regex
parameters.description: Download files matching this regular expression

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Download only files containing this text fragment

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Create this directory and download files to it

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Name of unzip application (unzip|gunzip) (DEFAULT: gunzip)

parameters.name: regex
parameters.description: Unzip only files matching this regular expression

parameters.name: delete
parameters.description: Remove zipped files after unzipping

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Unzip only files containing this text fragment

parameters.name: inputdir
parameters.description: Name of unzip application (unzip|gunzip) (DEFAULT: gunzip)

parameters.name: outputdir
parameters.description: Unzip files to this directory

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key for features in JBrowse

parameters.name: cpus
parameters.description: Number of cpus per job

parameters.name: build
parameters.description: Reference species build (e.g., hg19, mm9, rn4)

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label for experiment (e.g., bowtie)

parameters.name: sleep
parameters.description: Length of sleep in seconds between queue polls (default: 5)

parameters.name: jbrowse
parameters.description: Location of JBrowse installation (default: JBROWSE key value in default.conf file.)

parameters.name: maxjobs
parameters.description: Maximum number of jobs to be running or queued concurrently (default: 100)

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: Reference species (e.g., human, mouse, rat)

parameters.name: tempdir
parameters.description: Use this temporary directory to write data on execution host

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of input file. If not defined, the application will process all files in the inputdir.
parameters.paramFunction: if ( hits != null && hits !=  ) { return hits.match(/([^\/]+)$/)[1]; } for ( var i = 0; i < inputs.length; i++) { if ( inputs[i].value.match(/([^/]+.bam)$/) ) { return inputs[i].value.match(/([^/]+.bam)$/)[1]; }}

parameters.name: filetype
parameters.description: Type of input file (bam or gff)

parameters.name: inputdir
parameters.description: Directory with chromosome subdirs containing input files. JBrowse output files will be printed to subdirs
parameters.paramFunction: if ( outdir1 != null && outdir1 !=  ) return outdir1; if ( outdir2 != null && outdir2 !=  ) return outdir2;
